In a message dated 3/5/03 6:40:04 AM Central Standard Time, 
cardhead649@... writes:


> "Only Skywarp and myself realized you had a crush on him - the rest 
> thought you were just overloyal."   

She smiled. "I was extremely loyal to Megatron." she never mentioned the many 
time he rescued her before the Great War.  

   
  Empath puts her hands on her > hips.  "And you've certainly picked an 
> interesting  way of killing me -
> are you trying to talk me to death?  It sure didn't work for 
> Megatron."  She's teasing again. 

"Your termination is only an option. Though I have orders, does it make sense 
other than one's revenge?" She only gazed out. "Besides, if there is some 
reason for my being here, then all the loyal Decepticons will be needed." 
Then smirking, as she faced Empath. "Well.. Talking you to bordom & ceasing 
to function could be an option. Though I am sure I am far better to listen to 
than Starscream." 

She sighed. "I don't intend to betray Hydras. If he uses me, then so be it. 
Let him try. His plans are obviously of revenge. There is too much of 
Galvatron in him." Pausing a moment. "Yes, it tears me apart to think that 
Hydras is both our Leader & yet not our Leader." 

> "You know, I could probably get 
> Wheeljack to short your emotion chips if you wanted."

"No need, Empath. Soon enough, I shall have rid myself of this Techno organic 
form & regained my old form." Her optics sparkled. "They will all soon know 
the meaning of Decepticon might." 

She turned to Empath, facing her. "Join me, Empath. To return to the glory & 
splendor of what we once were. Hydras can have his Predacon wannabes. WE 
shall resurrect the Decepticons!"  

She wasn't sure if Empath would accept, probably not. In any case, Maxima 
would be alone in her quest. & her feelings for Hydras would continue as she 
saw fit.

--part1_1d5.453b41e.2b97bd1d_boundary
Content-Type: text/html; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
